#summary This page explains how to build HeeksCAD packages for Debian and derivatives (Ubuntu, Linux Mint, etc.)
#labels Featured,Phase-Requirements,Phase-Deploy

= Requirement: libarea =
HeeksCAD requires libarea, this section will explain how to build and install libarea using the Debian way.

== Install build dependencies ==
{{{
sudo apt-get install subversion build-essential debhelper cmake libboost-python-dev
}}}

== Fetch sources ==
{{{
svn checkout http://libarea.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ libarea
cd libarea
}}}

== Build packages ==

{{{
dpkg-buildpackage -b -us -uc
}}}

This will produces 3 packages: libarea0, libarea-dev and python-area.

== Install packages ==
{{{
cd ..
sudo dpkg -i libarea*.deb python-area*.deb
}}}

= HeeksCAD =
When libarea is correctly installed, we can build HeeksCAD packages the same way.

== Install build dependencies ==
{{{
sudo apt-get install libopencascade-dev libwxgtk2.8-dev libwxbase2.8-dev libgtkglext1-dev python-dev
}}}

== Fetch sources ==

{{{
svn checkout http://libarea.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ heekscad
cd heekscad
}}}

== Build packages ==

{{{
dpkg-buildpackage -b -us -uc
}}}

This will produces 2 packages: heekscad and heekscad-dev

== Install run-time dependencies ==
{{{
sudo apt-get install wx2.8-i18n
}}}

== Install packages ==
{{{
cd ..
sudo dpkg -i heekscad*.deb
}}}
